item.title: The Shadow Hour - Thinking food with Malana Ashley - FINAL - Feb 23,2012
item.description:
Herbalist and Naturopath, Malana Ashie, joins us again. Tonight shes going to talk to as about plants in a way that youve never heard before. You may never view your food the same way again. This will be the final broadcast of The Shadow Hour. Thanks for all the support youve given. Chris will be passing the station on to a colleague for a different kind of show in the future. Stay tuned to the web site for news about that soon. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Thomas Fusco -- behind the Cosmic Veil - Feb 09,2012
item.description:
Our guest tonight is Thomas P. Fusco, an independent researcher who has devoted nearly three decades investigating the relationship between mind, physics, spirituality, parapsychology, scientific anomalies and paranormal phenomena with the goal of uncovering the unifying cosmological framework that has eluded mankind for generations. He has been invited to speak as a guest on numerous radio programs. Hell be talking to us about the theory of supergeometry presented in his book, Behind the Cosmic Veil: A New Vision of Reality that describes a new model of supernatural mechanics, which not only explains the behavior of strange phenomena like the paranormal and UFOs, but also provides compelling answers to some of the fundamental problems facing physics today. This cosmological model is based in part on a lost Biblical cosmology that has been hiding in plain sight for centuries. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Aura Ajayi Carroll, the Oracle - Feb 02,2012
item.description:
Our guest tonight, Aura Ajayi Carroll, reminds us of the Oracle character in the Matrix film series, so you know its going to be cool! Shes also a friend of Uri Geller. Aura does her own program, both audio and TV (see the show notes). Well discuss that story as well as Auras experiences and research into the strange, odd and unusual. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Hypnotist, James Hazlerig on resolutions - Jan 05,2012
item.description:
James Hazlerig is a hypnotist in the Austin, Texas area who works with many people to help them overcome fears and addictions. Were going to talk about the kinds of thinking that work against us when we want to do something for the new year and what strategies we can use to help keep on track. For more information about James work in hypnosis, visit his web site, Harmony Hypnosis. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Reverend Mark - paranormal counselor - Dec 22,2011
item.description:
This will be our last broadcast of 2011. Reverend Mark Manly is different from many of the paranormal investigators that weve spoken with in the past on The Shadow Hour. He is an ordained minister with a Doctorate degree in philosophy and a secondary degree in psychology. He is also a certified grief councelor. What would lead a man such as this into the world of the paranormal? Hell explain what drew him to this path and how his spiritual perspective affects how he deals with what some would label "the supernatural." Well also talk about how his experience has led him into some new activities as a public speaker and Master of Ceremonies for events. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Michael Graves, A Catfish Tale - Nov 03,2011
item.description:
Michael Graves visited the very haunted Catfish Plantation restaurant in Waxahachie, Texas. He took a lot of pictures, several of which had some interesting anomolies. Are they ghosts? Well talk to him about his experience and the things that he could not capture in a photograph. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. item.title: The Shadow Hour - Jack the Ripper in Texas? - Oct 06,2011
item.description:
For the past several years, Chris has spoken with his friend David Marsh about a remarkable time in Austin, Texas. In 1884-1885 the city was terrorized by a serial killer whos brutal attacks were rimniscent of the infamous acts of Jack the Ripper. There have been dozens of works which recall the murders in White Chapel, yet the Austin victims go virtually unrecognized. David has dug very deeply into this story and will share the events as well the mysteries that surround them as we remember the victims. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Voice of the Unknown, the movie - Sep 08,2011
item.description:
As the interest in paranormal investigation works its way through the media pathway, isnt it time that we had "Ghost Hunter, the Motion Picture?" Your host might not line up for that one, but he is interested in seeing the outcome of guest, Will Scovilles film "Voice of the Unknown, A Paranormal Investigation." Will has been working in films and television for years, but you dont have to believe us— check out his IMDB page. When Will encountered friends and family who were involved with paranormal investigation, he saw the opportunity to tell an interesting story. We talked a while back with Robbie Prince about this project from the view of the investigative team. Now well hear about it from the view of the film makers. Call in with your questions during the live broadcast. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Paranormal debunking - Aug 25,2011
item.description:
ABCs Nightline has begun a series called "Beyond Belief" that is examining paranormal claims. Their first segment, which aired 8/16/2011, mostly featured Banachek, a magician who is an outspoken critic of psychics. Since Banachek is a mentalist, a performer who uses stage magicians techniques to simulate mind reading and other types phenomena, he is well positioned to discus how such things can be faked. He will appear on Nightline again to demonstrate his "million dollar challenge" where he says he will give $1 million to anyone who can pass his test. Clearly, Banachek, and people like him, believe passionately that they are fighting an important battle. They feel that people are being cheated and harmed by a belief in psychic phenomena. How does their concern affect other areas of the paranormal? Is the search for ghosts and other curiosities simply a sort of escape? Are we causing more harm than good? Tonight, well open the lines to your calls to discuss the debunking claims and how it compares to your own experiences. We will try to follow these segments and continue the discussion as the Nightline series continues. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

paranormal | psychic | ghosts | debunking | UFO

We will try to follow these segments and continue the discussion as the Nightline series continues. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

paranormal | psychic | ghosts | debunking | UFO
item.itunes:summary: ABCs Nightline has begun a series called "Beyond Belief" that is examining paranormal claims. Their first segment, which aired 8/16/2011, mostly featured Banachek, a magician who is an outspoken critic of psychics. Since Banachek is a mentalist, a performer who uses stage magicians techniques to simulate mind reading and other types phenomena, he is well positioned to discus how such things can be faked. He will appear on Nightline again to demonstrate his "million dollar challenge" where he says he will give $1 million to anyone who can pass his test. Clearly, Banachek, and people like him, believe passionately that they are fighting an important battle. They feel that people are being cheated and harmed by a belief in psychic phenomena. How does their concern affect other areas of the paranormal? Is the search for ghosts and other curiosities simply a sort of escape? Are we causing more harm than good? Tonight, well open the lines to your calls to discuss the debunking claims and how it compares to your own experiences. We will try to follow these segments and continue the discussion as the Nightline series continues. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Always after me lucky charms - Jul 28,2011
item.description:
This last weekend, Chris went to a reunion of people from his High School drama group. His teacher, Chuck Lytle, performed a ritual that was done before every show. He passed around a little toy mouse — the same one in fact! — and everyone got to rub it for luck. The feelings that moment brought back were so tangible that Chris has decided to devote tonights open lines program to talking about luck. Do you believe in it? Can we affect it? Can we change it? Call in with your own stories and perspectives and tell us about your own lucky charms. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Open Lines. Prodigies and posers - Jun 30,2011
item.description:
Its open lines tonight, so a great chance to call in and share your story or your view. Tonight, Chris and Mark will talk about the world of paranormal followers. If you follow the shows or the chat rooms you might feel that everyone has had a significant paranormal experience... something spectacular. For many others that experience seems to be much more elusive. Are people stretching the truth? Are they just more sensitive? Is it like Harry Potter, where you have to born into it or be a poor muggle for all your life? You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: Dragonskull Radio - Jim Magus on Tony Andruzzi - Apr 13,2011
item.description:
This is a guest show on The Shadow Hour channel. If you are interested in the paranormal, you will probably prefer The Shadow Hour on Wednesday nights. Welcome to the Dragonskull, a place where practitioners of Bizarre Magic gather, if they can find the way in. Its a world devoted to this most unusual art form that combines the skill of the magician with the charisma of the storyteller and the detail of the artisan. This month features Jim Magus, author of "Unspeakable Acts," the biography of Tony Andruzzi. We will talk about Jims experiences in this period of Bizarre and some of what he learned about Tony in writing this book.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - What bumps in the dark - Mar 31,2011
item.description:
Scott Wells and Jamie Salinas are entertainers in Houston, Texas. They created a show with special effects, depicting a séance purely for entertainment purposes. To add to the realism, they arranged to perform their program in a location that has a haunted history. What they did not expect was that their foray into the imaginary world of ghosts would put them face-to-face with real haunted activity. The will talk about some of the ways that the unseen world has intruded into their show, the experiences that they and guests have had and how these experiences have affected their view of the paranormal. This will be a good one to call into if you can listen live. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Conspiracy or coincidence? - Feb 17,2011
item.description:
Join us on The Shadow Hour for information about the strange, odd and unusual. There has been a lot of strange activity, from weird weather, to mass animal deaths and more UFO sightings. What is going on? Our assistant producer, Mark Faulkner, has been curious about these things as well and has been doing some digging. We're going to talk about the theories he has uncovered and some of the clues that he has found. We'll also be taking calls so you can give your input. item.description:
At the metaphysical fair in Austin, Texas, Chris met Diane Parma. Diane is a Numerologist, Card Reader and Reiki Practitioner, but we will be focusing on her experience with numerology. Since the days of Pythagoras people have looked at how numbers are reflected in and may affect the world around us. Learn a little about why this might make sense and some numbers that you may want to look for in your life. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. item.title: Dragonskull Radio - Walt Anthony and Eugene Poinc - Jan 12,2011
item.description:
This is a guest show on The Shadow Hour channel. If you are interested in the paranormal, you will probably prefer The Shadow Hour on Wednesday nights. Welcome to the Dragonskull, a place where practitioners of Bizarre Magic gather, if they can find the way in. It's a world devoted to this most unusual art form that combines the skill of the magician with the charisma of the storyteller and the detail of the artisan. My guest will be Walt Anthony. He has agreed to take me into the mysterious Cave of Eugene Poinc to discuss how that relationship influenced his view of Bizarre Magick as well as reminiscences of what Eugene was really like and the differences between the man and the legend. It promises to be a great program. Walt is diligent and organized and I can't wait to hear what he has to say. I have directions to Eugene's apartment written on this cocktail napkin... oh... it's run a bit... I'm sure I'll be able to find it!

item.title: The Shadow Hour - A Christmas Carol - Dec 23,2010
item.description:
Later in his life, Charles Dickens travelled throughout Europe and the United States doing dramatic readings of his works. His most popular reading was the tale that we still turn to each December, A Christmas Carol. Last year, at a special event for the Museum of the Weird, Chris Walden played the part of Charles Dickens, reading aloud his classic story of love and humanity. This week, on The Shadow Hour, Chris will again perform that reading for all of you, using the same edited text that Dickens did more than a century ago. Gather with your loved ones and hear one of the most famous ghost stories ever, presented in the immortal words if its creator. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

Gather with your loved ones and hear one of the most famous ghost stories ever, presented in the immortal words if its creator. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Encountering skeptics for the holidays - Dec 16,2010
item.description:
No matter what your beliefs or your background, you are likely to be spending time with family and friends in December. You may get those awkward questions like Aunt Sally asking "Are you still worshiping the devil, dear?" We all encounter people who are uncomfortable with our interests in the paranormal. Tonight we'll open the lines and talk about how to cope-- without having to turn anyone into anything. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - The Sceptic and the Ghostie - Dec 02,2010
item.description:
Amy ParaMinx and Erik Shaltis from Fate Radio's "The Sceptic and the Ghostie" will be joining us. As a couple, they approach the paranormal from different views. She has a background in the world of the psychic and ritual magic. He looks at things from a scientific point of view. (They do say opposites attract.) We'll talk about the conflicts this can cause for their exploration and the benefits that they receive as their investigative worlds colide. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: Dragonskull Radio - Paul Prater - Nov 10,2010
item.description:
This is a guest show on The Shadow Hour channel. If you are interested in the paranormal, you will probably prefer The Shadow Hour on Wednesday nights. Welcome to the Dragonskull, a place where practitioners of Bizarre Magic gather, if they can find the way in. It's a world devoted to this most unusual art form that combines the skill of the magician with the charisma of the storyteller and the detail of the artisan. This month's guest is Paul Prater. We'll be talking about the challenge of finding or creating the opportunities for Bizarre performances.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Ed Grimsley with a UFO Update - Nov 04,2010
item.description:
Ed Grimsley was one of the very first guests on The Shadow Hour. He's coming back with reports about strange new things that he is seeing in the skies with night-vision technology. We'll talk about these objects, their behaviors and what he thinks they mean. We'll also talk about the constant news about UFOs and the trend of government opening their records. What does it mean? Are we being protected or is there something more sinister afoot? You can call and talk to Ed directly. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.description:

This is a special treat, because the Halloween season is very busy for him. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. item.title: Dragonskull Radio - Joe Cabral - Sep 15,2010
item.description:
This is a guest show on The Shadow Hour channel. If you are interested in the paranormal, you will probably prefer The Shadow Hour on Wednesday nights. Welcome to the Dragonskull, a place where practitioners of Bizarre Magic gather, if they can find the way in. It's a world devoted to this most unusual art form that combines the skill of the magician with the charisma of the storyteller and the detail of the artisan. You'll enjoy discussion about the world of Bizarre Magic, interviews with performers, product reviews and more. You will be able to call in live during portions of the show and talk to guests directly. Our premiere episode features Joe Cabral who will talk to us about the history of the Inner Circle of Bizarre Magick. See more about the ICBM at the web site. Also, be sure to visit the original Dragonskull web site at dragonskull.co.uk

You'll enjoy discussion about the world of Bizarre Magic, interviews with performers, product reviews and more. You will be able to call in live during portions of the show and talk to guests directly. Our premiere episode features Joe Cabral who will talk to us about the history of the Inner Circle of Bizarre Magick. See more about the ICBM at the web site. Also, be sure to visit the original Dragonskull web site at dragonskull.co.uk

item.itunes:subtitle: Dragonskull Radio - Joe Cabral

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Jentri Chancey talks about her film "What I know for sure" - Sep 09,2010
item.description:
Jentri chancey created a documentary in which she asked one hundred people the same question and received a surprising variety of answers and reactions. I can't tell you what the question is, but you can get an idea of the kinds of answers she received by looking at the film's trailer on YouTube. I don't think I can convince her to tell us the question, but we will talk to her about the inspiration for the film and what she learned by discussing answers with all those different people. In addition, we'll also be discussing a little bit of Jentri's background in parnormal investigation with their Aether Paranormal Team. It promises to be an unusual and interesting program. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Ed Fulco, author of The Cosmic Seed - Jul 22,2010
item.description:
It takes time to write a book. Most authors struggle with inspiration as their book unfolds over time. Our guest, Ed Fulco, received instant and complete inspiration for his book, The Cosmic Seed, years after a personal experience with a UFO. In addition to the novel he has also been inspired with the Universal Learning Concepts, 13 concepts that can guide a person to their best possible end. Has Ed been gifted with an incredibly fertile imagination, or is his gift a special kind of contact with knowledge beyond our Earth? We'll talk to him about his book, his ideas and experiences. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list. Be sure to follow the show notes about this program for links to news and other information.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Haunted Yorktown Memorial Hospital - Jun 17,2010
item.description:
Angelka Rogers was on our show shortly after the Texas Ghost Show, sharing with us some of her experiences at the Black Swan Inn in San Antonio, TX. This time she will talk to us about the truly frightening encounters they have had at the Yorktown Memorial Hospital. We'll have some recordings from their work and tales a plenty... with your polite phone calls. Due to some strong language from the entities on the recordings of sessions at the hospital we have marked this episode as "mature." The language is brief, but R-rated. We thought it was better to let you hear the unaltered recording rather than censor it. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Ouija - Jun 10,2010
item.description:
Many people have strong feelings about the Ouija™ board. (Actually Ouija™ is a trademark for the product manufactured and sold by Parker Brothers, a toy and game company. The generic term is "talking board.") Is it simply a game? It is manufactured by a toy company and sold in toy stores. Yet we are warned again and again that talking boards are doorways to dark entities, demons and our worst fears in the unseen world. Tina Fiorda and Tilde Cameron have a different view of the subject. Their work, "A Book of Insight, " not only discusses the talking board, but was authored in part through communication through such a device. It promises to be an unusual program which may change your view, or strengthen what you already believe. You'll also be able to communicate with them directly with live phone calls. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Seeking - May 06,2010
item.description:
As host of The Shadow Hour, Chris has spoken to many people both on and off the air about their interest in the paranormal. Some are content to wonder, but others are compelled to go out and try to find their own truths. Popular television programs about paranormal investigations have encouraged many to begin their own groups who seek to examine locations for signs of the paranormal. But how do these groups prepare themselves for investigations? What image do they present to the world? Are they furthering the cause of finding the truth about what lies beyond our reality, or is it a sort of adult role-playing? Chris will talk about his own observations of the public face of paranormal investigation and suggest ways that begining groups can become effective champions of the truth. This will be a live call-in show, so if you have a group that does investigation you might want to listen for ideas, or call in to share your own tools and techniques. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Paranormal passion - Apr 15,2010
item.description:
Brian D. Byers and his wife Anna Marie also have a program, Ghostology, where they have pretty open and often very campy discussions about the world of paranormal investigation. In this era of reality television how are the average seekers affected by the flood of "paranormal entertainment." Does this sensationalizing of the weird work to improve investigation or does it detract? We'll talk about all the ways that people who love the paranormal can dig deeper and some of the side-effects that come from this vast interest in the weird. If you've not heard their program, these people are very smart and vastly entertaining. You will not want to miss the show. I predict fun and laughs along with profound thoughts to consider. Follow along with the Show Notes. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - The haunted Black Swan Inn, San Antonio, TX - Apr 08,2010
item.description:
The Black Swan Inn in San Antonio, Texas was the site of the Battle of Salado Creek and is reputed to be one of the most haunted places in North America. Angelka Rogers has been a witness to activity at the Black Swan. She has also been a part of several investigative events, including one using a strange device that is supposed to aid communication with the dead. Angelka will talk about her experiences and answer questions from your live phone calls. Follow along with the Show Notes. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - JavaBob and his personal search for Bigfoot - Apr 01,2010
item.description:
Bob Schmalzbach, better known as JavaBob, has, for many years, been on a quest after one of our favorite monsters, Bigfoot. He has made the journey that many others have from skepticism to curiosity to the ultimate demand for the truth. Tonight he will talk about his personal journey into the monster-hunting lifestyle as well as his observations on the state of current findings and the challenges that are presented by so-called "arm-chair cryptozoologists." Join us on The Shadow Hour for information about the strange, odd and unusual. We'll have Shadow Noes from around the world and open lines for you to share your own thoughts and stories about tonight's topic. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/. For more details follow along with tonight's Show Notes.

item.title: MonterQuest Live Party - Good News and Bad News - Mar 25,2010
item.description:
The good news is that the live MonsterQuest party went well.  We had enthusiastic people and it was a lot of fun.  We were all disappointed to find that the Gable Film was not only a hoax, but an orchestrated one.  A massive lightening storm in Austin took out the station just as they were explaining how everything had been done, so we missed the last 10 minutes.  However, from what I understand they only explained the Gable Film and did not review the other sightings that were covered at th beginning of the show.

One of our guests, Richard, said that he would like to know more about what the History Channel producers knew and when they knew it, suggesting that it would be a very bad thing if they had something to do with the creation of this hoax.

We also met Heidi, Lupe, Ranferri and Gharith who shared that for them it was sad that the mystery of the Gable Film ended as it did, but it did not shake their feeling that there was something undiscovered which might explain the many "man wolf" sightings that occur.  Steve Busti's wife also chimed in to say how glad she was that Steve would no longer have to spend time researching this subject.

The bad news was that a technical difficulty made the recording of this show unusable.  Everything came out well over the PA on location, but Steve's mic was the only one that could be heard on the broadcast.  One listener tried to tell us about the problem in the chat room but we didn't get enough feedback to understand and troubleshoot the problem.  We'll do some additional testing to discover the issue and make sure that the next event goes out correctly.

Sorry for the inconvenience.  We're disappointed too.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Lura Ketchledge, a life transformed - Feb 25,2010
item.description:
Lura Ketchledge was a normal, fun-loving woman who considered herself to be skeptical about ghosts, psychics and other areas of the paranormal. A horseback riding accident forever changed her path as she passed briefly to the other side and returned. Since that experience she has had the ability to see and speak with the dead. However, Lura does not have a TV show, or do readings in hotels. She quietly continues to explore her gift and does her best to tell her story through works of fiction. Lura will talk to us about her transformation, her experiences, and her upcoming books, which are yet to be published. She'll also share a personal quest where she could use your help. See the show notes for full details on Lura's work. Sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/

item.title: 1/27/2010 - Brian Harnois - Jan 28,2010
item.description:
If you saw Brian Harnois on Ghost Hunters you've only got a small part of the story. Join us as Chris Walden talks one-on-one with Brian about his background in the paranormal, the things that you miss on televised paranormal investigations, and the work he is doing to improve the quality of investigations throughout the paranormal community. You don't want to miss this show! We'll also have Shadow News and your live phone calls with questions fro Brian. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/

item.title: The Shadow Hour - 1/20/2010 - International Psychic, Ericka Boussarhane - Jan 21,2010
item.description:
We are so pleased to welcome internationally known psychic, Ericka Boussarhane to the show to talk about the nature of psychic information and her own evolution in discovery of her gifts. We'll also talk about some of the many services that she has provided, including investigations of hauntings. Ericka will be a guest at the Texas Ghost Show, coming up in March. We'll also have shadow news and welcome your phone calls. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/. Check out the show notes for information and a link to Ericka's book. Don't forget to Digg our show.

item.title: 1/13/2010 - Larry Flaxman from ARPAST.org - Jan 14,2010
item.description:
Larry Flaxman works with the The Arkansas Paranormal and Anomalous Studies Team, science-based research group dedicated to furthering our measured understanding of anomalous and unexplained phenomena via the utilization of state-of-the-art equipment, methodologies, and techniques. Larry will talk to us about the scientific approach to paranormal investigation and what they have uncovered. We'll also have Shadow News and your phone calls. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/

item.title: 1/6/2010 - Dr. Rita Louise on body, mind and spirit health. - Jan 07,2010
item.description:
In the United States we are undergoing changes in our approach to health care. We may not be able to control what the government does, but we can control what we do for ourselves. Doctor Rita Louise is a Naturopathic Physician and a 20-year veteran in the Human Potential Field. She has some definite ideas about how we can make a difference for our self and our health no matter what happens around us. She'll be talking to us tonight and taking your phone calls. You can sign up for our Twitter and our free mailing list, as well as get additional notes for every program at our web site: http://shadowhour.com/

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Orgone Energy - Dec 17,2009
item.description:
Independent researcher Nick Limos joins us to night to talk about Orgone Energy. It was first proposed by psychoanalyst Wilhelm Reich in the 1930s. Reich received an injunction by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration against Orgone-related products and was subsequently jailed for continuing to distribute products related to Orgone energy. Reich died in prison in 1957. Limos believes that there really are benefits to Orgone energy. He will discuss the history of it's discovery, the subsequent persecution by the government against it and his own views of why this is something important for us to explore. We'll also have Shadow News and your live phone calls. For full information, see the show notes at http://shadowhour.com/.

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: The Shadow Hour - 11/25/2009 - Giving Thanks - Nov 26,2009
item.description:
One of the basic concepts of the Law of Attraction (as presented in the book and film "The Secret") is showing gratitude for the things that you have attracted into your life. This gratitude acknowledges that you are receiving what you want. In the United States, we celebrate the Thanksgiving holiday tomorrow. It is a time when the early settlers, with the help of the Native Americans, survived their first harsh season on this soil. It is the perfect opportunity for all of us to acknowledge what we are thankful for. Call in with your own stories of gratitude and tell the universe. We'll also have Shadow News. For full information, see the show notes at http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: 11/18/2009 - Into the Mind of One of Texas' Best Paranormal Investigators - Nov 19,2009
item.description:
One of our frequent guests, Donald Dennis, has recently been recognized by Haunted America Tours as one of the top ten best paranormal investigators in Texas. He has agreed to be on the hot seat with us this week. We're not going to talk about procedures or specific investigations. We're going to find out what motivates someone like Dennis to investigate the paranormal and what he really believes. You will want to call in for this one! We'll also have Shadow News. For full information, see the show notes at http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - Jeff Danelek talks about his book 2012: Extinction or Utopia. - Oct 15,2009
item.description:
Those of you who joined us last week were disappointed, as were we, to find that technical difficulties with Blog Talk Radio forced us to end the broadcast. (This is nothing against Blog Talk Radio! We still love them!) We were unable to catch up again with Chris Dedman because of schedule conflicts, however we were able to arrange a recorded interview with Jeff Danelek. You may recognize Jeff from his previous appearance on the show talking about his book "The Case For Ghosts." This time he's sharing his research about 2012 and doomsday prophecies in general. No live calls tonight, but you'll enjoy Jeff's insight. For full information, see the show notes at http://shadowhour.com/.

item.title: The Shadow Hour - 9/9/2009 - Dr. Phylis Canion and the Texas Chupacabra - Sep 10,2009
item.description:
Sorry to do it again, but we just had to change the theme of the show to take advantage of an opportunity. You would have to have been living on another planet to not have heard of the mysterious Texas Chupacabra that has been seen. Dr. Pylis Canion owns a ranch in Cuero, Texas. She had seen the creature on her property and was looking for a way to get more information when she discovered a corpse. It's been studied by researchers at Texas A & M University and it's an amazing story. We'll be talking to her live about her story and her reaction to the increasing evidence of these creatures. We'll also have Shadow News and your live phone calls. For full information, see the show notes at http://shadowhour.com/.

We'll talk about how Murphy combines legend and research with imagination to bring the world of the parnaormal to life. We'll also have Shadow News and your phone calls. item.title: The Shadow Hour - Cryptozoologist Ken Gerhard - May 14,2009
item.description:
Ken is a noted cryptozoologist and field researcher for The Centre for Fortean Zoology and Gulf Coast Bigfoot Research Organization, as well as being a fellow of the Pangea Institute. Ken has investigated reports of monsters and mysterious creatures all over the world, including Bigfoot, the Loch Ness Monster, the Chupacabras, thunderbirds and even werewolves. In addition to appearing on two episodes of the History Channel TV series Monster Quest, he is featured on the A&E/Travel Channel program, Legend Hunters, as well as numerous radio and Internet programs. Ken’s credits include appearances on Eyewitness News and Ireland’s Newstalk Radio, as well as being featured in major books, DVDs and in articles by the Associated Press, Tampa Tribune and Amarillo Edge. Gerhard is author of the books Big Bird: Modern Sightings of Flying Monsters and Monsters are Real! He has written for publications such as Animals and Men, The Journal of the British Columbia Scientific Cryptozoology Club and Bigfoot Times. He has lectured at MUFON events, the Southern Crypto Conference and GhostTechCon and has exhibited at paranormal conferences in Texas, Washington State and Massachusetts. Born on Friday the 13th of October 1967, Ken has traveled to twenty-six different countries and has visited forty-three of the United States. An avid adventurer, he has camped along the Amazon, sailed the Galapagos, hiked the Australian Outback and visited many ancient sites from Machu Pichu to Stonehenge. He will talk about his research and experiences. We'll also have shadow news and your phone calls. See more information in the show notes on http://shadowhour.com/

item.itunes:author: Chris Walden
item.itunes:subtitle: The Shadow Hour - World Premiere

item.title: Countdown to our World Premiere - Apr 25,2009
item.description:
The countdown continues to the premiere episode of The Shadow Hour, on Blog Talk Radio.  We've got our broadcast facilities nearly ready.  We've been doing engineering tests and preparing for what will hopefully be a smooth launch of the program.

The most exciting news is that we have confirmed Steve Busti, the owner of the the Museum of the Weird in Austin, Texas, as our special guest.  Steve has a very interesting background and has a great deal of enthusiasm for the bizarre artifacts that he has collected.

Please listen in and be sure to call to ask some questions and share your own enthusiasm for the wonderful world of the weird.

Don't forget to sign up to follow us on Twitter, and sign up for our news announcements.  You can do that at our web page:  http://shadowhour.com/.


Shadow | hour | paranormal | premiere | countdown | april 29 | weird | museum | austin | steve busti

item.title: The Shadow Hour is coming to you soon. - Apr 13,2009
item.description:
We have finally scheduled the premiere of The Shadow Hour for Wednesday, April 29, 2009 at 10:00 PM Central time.  You can receive instant news and updates by following us on Twitter.  You can also sign up for our newsletters.

If you would like to be a guest on our show, please contact us through guests@shadowhour.com,.
